Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: erskine49
Reviews.Content: The room was quite large although basic (but adequate). Everything was clean and ready for our stay. Bed was comfortable and clean...couldn't really find any faults. The staff everywhere were so professional, friendly and helpful. Jason is top drawer! ...next time Jason, a room overlooking the harbour please! Location is perfect...right next door to Kings Cross Station. Anything upset me...yes! No foreign news channel (eg Fox News Channel) grrr!...and, please, lets have free wifi in the rooms. Seriously, the best value hotel I have stayed at in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great outlook and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: ShepLapstone
Reviews.Content: I only booked at this hotel because I couldn't find good value in the City over Easter. I was very pleasantly surprised with the absolutely beautiful view from my room overlooking the harbour bridge, opera house and city. I was also surprised at the excellent standard of my room and the hotel ameneities. The staff were all helpful and friendly. Kings Cross station was steps away and I could reach the centre of the city by train in 5 minutes. Comfortable bed and good size functional bathroom and room tastefully decorated. The Kings Cross area is probably good for those who like the nightlife, otherwise I don't find it all that suited to my activities, not but once inside the hotel I must say it was extremely quiet. You don't have to venture far to reach the harbour shores where there are very pleasant parks and walks. I would definitely return again if I could find as good a value for the room again.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful Location”
Reviews.Author: kdhl1000
Reviews.Content: Room was fine. Hotel is near King's Cross train station, however, be aware that this hotel is a block away from King's Cross Road which is the red light district. Front desk will advise you not to walk with valuables on King's Cross Road. Our room was on the second floor next to a club and we could hear the music until the morning.Not good for families with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the city”
Reviews.Author: politebat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday in on the first leg of my honeymoon in Sydney Feb and March 2012. The hotel was very clean and easy to find. Room service was really nice and offered a few types of pillows for us to use at no extra cost. The room was a little small, but not to small...so me and my wife fit pretty well. i was there during Mardi Gras so at night it got kinda loud out on the street, im not sure if it is like that just for Mardi Gras or if its always like that. Also on the next street over there are alot of sex shops and strip places, which did not bother me and the wife, but if we had kids, i would not want them walking down that street, so families keep that in mind. That being said the Subway (Kings Cross) is directly next door, and i mean directly....so its really really close. Also there is a shopping center with a grocery store (Coles), subway and an internet cafe across the street. Also alot of food options are near, so that was nice. All around a good hotel, i will come back. i also ran into the band Switchfoot in the lobby, they were staying there as well, so that was cool. As far internet, the guy at the front desk told me it was pretty expansive in room, but everyday they give 20 mins of free wifi in the lobby per device. So seeing as though i brought two tablets and one cell phone, i got an hour free internet each day. Just don't try to upload pics on the free 20 mins, you only have a limited supply of MBs and once that's used up, free time is over even if you still have mins left. But it was a good hotel, i plan to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Well-located but clinical”
Reviews.Author: eMole
Reviews.Content: Pros: Right outside the Kings Cross station and within short walking distance from great night life at Kings Cross/Darlinghurst. Room is large and clean. Mine even had a partial view of the Harbour Bridge from afar. Cons: Contrary to some other reivews on this hotel, I didn't find that it had any personality whatsoever and the staff at the reception counter were emotionless. It's not a big disappointment, however, as you'd expect such at these mid-range hotel chains.

Reviews.Title: “A good solid city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wayne G
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent property for the relatively low price. It's well located in Kings Cross adjacent to the rail station. 5 minute trip into the CBD by train and 15 mins by foot. The rooms are quiet and the area Bohemian if that's what you seek.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly and helpful staff, breakfast buffet is outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Dee Y
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have stayed at this hotel for 1 night up to a week during 2011. The location is right above the Kings Cross train station, only 10-15 minute walk to the CBD, is handy to all the restaurants and cafes in Potts Point/Kings Cross and Darlinghurst within easy walking distance. There is a personality in this area that the CBD definitely lacks...I know, we used to stay at the Mantra2 Bond St which had very good amenities but lacked any vibe, so we traded this for the many pluses that Potts Point offers. There is a small good supermarket close by (Harris Farms), plus numerous delicatessens if you don't want to eat out. For our longer stays, we buy salads etc from the deli and the helpful hotel staff provide us with plates, bowls, cutlery etc. Be sure to join the Rewards program, free, which gives you later checkout, newspapers etc, particularly if you are visiting this hotel or others in the same program. We quite often made a booking that includes breakfast. The breakfast buffet is much better than most hotels, we can make our own fresh juices, has a wide selection for fresh fruit, muesli and nuts etc, plus hot food (which we cannot comment on because we have never gone beyond the fresh fruit bar). Be sure to ask for a room as high as possible facing the harbor. If you are there Thurs/Fri/Sat night try and avoid the Victoria St end because Kings Cross is noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Hidden Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Trotter_Paraleo
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights on a holiday in Mar'11 and truly loved it. Refreshing with a friendly and casual atmosphere. Rooms are spacious and comfortable. What makes it stand out is its location which couldn't be better, it is adjacent to the Kings Cross Metro station right at the edge of Victoria St which is literally walk out of the station and walk into the hotel. You could be in Darling Harbor in 5 mins, Bondi Beach in 10 to 15 mins and Harbor Bridge and Opera in 10 mins, you name it. Right there in the heart of Sydney's cafe and dining precinct. Night life is a stone's throw distance away at the notorious Kings Cross, although I missed the night out due to a lot of exploring around the city. You could also take a train and visit Blue Mountains. Its a two train ride to Katoomba, quite enjoyed it. Another thing to do would be Taronga Zoo, may be a little expensive but boasts of great views of Sydney, just a boat ride from the harbor. Hotel staff were just terrific, always there to help. Although it is not a upscale hotel but whatever it offers is top notch. Breakfast was just great, just the right thing to kick start your day, the quality was phenomenal and spread quite decent, all that you need. One of the best vegetable omelette I'd always remember.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable hotel”
Reviews.Author: mantisalive
Reviews.Content: Service is good, bed is comfortable, rooms could do with a bit of an update & toilet doesnt flush that well. But its clean & great location for a party. Its entertaining watching everyone come out to party for a night on the town (if you have a room overlooking the strip). Overall would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every cent!”
Reviews.Author: Jono J
Reviews.Content: Fantastic views (have to ask for Harbour view room), location to eastern suburbs, short walk to CBD and cafes galore. Service excellent and delicious breakfast. Always stay here when visiting. For things to do in Sydney for up to 7 days check out my blog: www.sydney-jono.blogspot.com

Reviews.Title: “Well located, clean modern room, noisy aircondtioner”
Reviews.Author: Daletnurse
Reviews.Content: Well located in Kings Cross, near train station, helpful staff, near to the city. I stayed for 3 nights for business and was generally pleased with the hotel. Arrived late in the evening, put the air-conditioner on as the room was quite warm. The air-conditioner fan was very loud and after a while realised I could not sleep with the noise. I phoned reception and reported it and the friendly staff member offered to move me to another room. I declined as I didn't feel like moving room at that time of the night and asked they look into it the next day, and she said they would. I turned it off and eventually went to sleep. Nothing was done about it and thankfully I was able to turn it off each night before I went to sleep. I was disappointed with the lack of follow-up. I ordered the lasagne for dinner on my final night and it arrived barely warm. I reported it and they eventually bought me another, warm this time. Not sue I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: braidmacd
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the price especially if you get the tower above the fifth floor for awesome views of the Harbor Bridge and Opera House. Our tower room was clean and well appointed and equipped. The staff was extremely friendly and competent. The Kingâ€™s Cross railway station is next door to the hotel. Plenty of restaurants in the area. We especially enjoyed Watermoon as well as MacLeay Street Bistro and Anong restaurants. Avoid at all costs Mere Catherine.

Reviews.Title: “The Holiday Inn â€œPittsâ€� Point”
Reviews.Author: PerthMovers
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Potts Point is a hotel well past its prime. Iâ€™m not sure what the life-cycle of a hotel is, but this one is in its death throes. Its stands at the atop the Ãœber â€“ edgy and slightly risquÃ© Kings Cross area of Sydney dressed in a string vest and shorts, when all around have moved on to long pants and cool evening wear. Itâ€™s the sort of hotel that when you walked in you wouldnâ€™t be surprised to read over the reception desk: â€œThe Holiday Inn Potts Point Welcomers all Members of The National Vacuum Owners Association to Their Yearly Dinner and Dance.â€� I spent one night here on business and frankly the few hours I was there was more than enough. The room on the 1st floor was so old and tired it was almost in a coma. Despite spending an age trying, I couldnâ€™t get the air-conditioning correct. So the room was unforgivingly humid and clammy. The bed is so uncomfortable it could have featured in a Monty Python sketch a-la: â€œThe Spanish Inquisition.â€� There is nothing relaxing about the place at all. In fact the entire experience sets you on edge if anything. Its only up-side if you can call it that is, for central-Sydney itâ€™s not that expensive. I think my bill for one night with breakfast came to $200 dollars (AUD) In life as in hotels you are faced with choices. Choose in haste- repent at leisure!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Anne Y
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel that has a good restaurant. The location was good as we were able to travel by train to the city and Bondi Junction for the shops. The staff were very helpful. The hotel had a regular bus pick up for the airport which was useful for the trip back to the UK. We travel between the UK and Australia every few months and like to try alternative hotels, after this stay we would choose to stay here again.Good value and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel. Good views. Very nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: Toptown
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed in the Holiday Inn Potts Point for two nights. The hotel reception was friendly and efficient. We were upgraded to a Harbour View room which was comfortable and quiet even though we were next to the lifts. We had two dinners, in the restaurant as the meals were so nice, so much so we would choose to eat here again when in this part of Sydney. The train station is also very handy and the best way to get to the CBD. Parking was easy and fairly priced. Another good choice of hotel for business or leisure we would say.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here on Contiki”
Reviews.Author: worldatmyfeet128
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week as part of a Contiki, the hotel itself is excellent! Very clean and spacious hotel; rooms are very clean, very spacious, well equipped (flat screen tv, phones and voice message system, minifridge etc). Loved the bathroom! Came with shower amenities as well. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Value I can't comment on as I didn't pay with Holiday Inn Potts Point so don't know what the price is for the room (as I said before I stayed here on a Contiki package). Free 20 min per day of wifi. Loved the courtyard/seating area outside! The location is great in the daytime, Kings Cross Station literally a few seconds from the door ... not so sure about night time, although I did go out around 9ish across the road to get some dinner, that wasn't bad, (I recommend mexican place Guzman Y Gomez by the way with the bright yellow sign, that was really nice and affordable too), I was too scared to go to the train station because I heard Kings Cross is dodgy "red-light", but I hope someone can prove me wrong about the train station because otherwise the Holiday Inn Potts Point is great!

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully styled hotel, cleanliness needs work though.”
Reviews.Author: barbarellahutch
Reviews.Content: My husband booked an evening here for us after a lovely dinner nearby and the actual hotel is so lovely. I love the decor, it looks very 1930's and could easily have come from the set of The Great Gatsby which really appeals to me. I liked everything about it except there was a clump of hairs on the waste bin in the bathroom that hadn't been properly cleaned away and one of the pillows, despite being wrapped in a lovely 'hard or soft" ribbon had ugly orange stains on it. That's fine if you're at home and they're your own stains but not acceptable at a hotel. The linen should be stain free. Anyway, it remains a beautiful hotel and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Dont book with Travel Republic!!”
Reviews.Author: The_Laverys
Reviews.Content: We ended up having to book this hotel after Travel Republic cancelled our booking in the Shangri La one day before check-in. Due to the lateness of cancellation we paid the same price for this hotel which it is not worth. Obviously this hotel is nowhere near the standard of the Shangri La but Travel Republic are refusing to acknowledge or compensate. Do yourself a favour and book with another company, any other company! The hotel itself is clean and comfortable however it's location is in a very busy, noisy area. If you book make sure you ask for a room at the side/back of the hotel as these are much quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Great sized room.”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneMellie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the heart of kings cross/potts point. The hotel is next to the train station which is very handy. The staff were helpful and accommodating. The only real let down of this place is that the rooms are tired looking and the carpet feels a bit gritty.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Stacey S
Reviews.Content: Hotel rates in Sydney â€“ and all of Australia for that matter â€“ are shocking during high season (Australian Summertime = US Winter) and so I ended up at a Holiday Inn Potts Point paying $198 AUD/night (about $203 USD at the time of this posting) - pricy for a Holiday Inn! Before my trip, I called Priority Club (the rewards program for Holiday Inn and the Intercontinental Hotel Group) and asked if they would match my Starwood Platinum Status. They were very happy to match my status for a trial period to Priority Club Platinum Status. After more than 38 hours of travel, 1 day in Germany and a 4-hour layover in Thailand I arrived in Sydney at 7am and discovered was rush hour down under really meant. An hour in a cab â€“ without air â€“ and I was at the Holiday Inn. My keys were ready when I arrived at check-in and oddly enough, no one asked me for any identification or credit card. I inquired about what my newly acquired platinum status got me, and I was told that it ensured my keys were ready at check-in. I asked if it got me free internet, and I was told no â€“ internet was $27.50 AUD per 24-hour period with a maximum of 250MB of data (after that, there was an additional fee). I asked if I got free water in my room with my platinum status and I was told no, but that the tap water in Sydney was drinkable (US tap water is drinkable too â€“I just choose to drink bottled water) . There was no executive lounge/concierge lounge and no free breakfast (breakfast was $29 per person for a continental buffet) I arrived to my room which had a spectacular view of Sydney Harbor and the Opera house. It was actually breathtaking â€“ and I presumed that may have been a benefit of Platinum Status. The room was large with one king bed and a small chair. The carpet was old and had an odd smell about it (like they had cleaned it, but I never really dried properly) but otherwise, the room was very clean. The bathroom looked like it had been redone recently. It was large with a large bathtub & shower. The water pressure was great in the shower. I was pleasantly surprised by room â€“ it was much better than I had anticipated it would be. The hotel proved to be quite conveniently located and was directly next to the Kings Cross Train Station. I was only in Sydney for three nights â€“ and so the Holiday Inn was adequate. I am not sure what the real benefit of Priority Club membership is. Compared to Starwood Preferred Guest (Iâ€™m Platinum) and Marriott Rewards (Iâ€™m gold) Priority Club seems to be the least rewarding program. This is my only Holiday Inn or IHG hotel during my 5 week trip â€“ and I have to say â€“ Iâ€™m kind of happy about that. Iâ€™ll stick to Starwood and Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Location if you do not plan on renting/hiring a car”
Reviews.Author: FoodiePA
Reviews.Content: Husband and I decided to extend our trip from New Zealand and visit Sydney for a week using all of our Priority Club Rewards Point before heading back to the States. Let us say, the rewards points were well used! The hotel is in a GREAT Location if you do not plan on renting/hiring a car. At the airport, we purchased a week long train pass called, MyMulti Day Pass. Using this train pass from the airport, we took the "Airport and East Hills Lines" to Central Station. From Central Station, we took the "Eastern Suburbs & Illawarra Line" to Kings Cross. At Kings Cross we took the LIFT,with ALL of our suitcases (We packed for a month!), straight up to Holiday Inn Potts Point - Sydney. The train ride was very safe and very clean! Because Holiday Inn Potts Point - Sydney had it's very own train station stop, having the MyMulti Day Pass made our trip very stress free and affordable! Outside of its convenient location, Holiday Inn Potts Point - Sydney was very accomadating. On one of the day we were in Sydney, it rained Cats and Dogs! But did it stop us!?! Heck NO!! Customer Service at Holiday Inn Potts Point - Sydney provided us TWO HUGE BRIGHT GREEN Umbrellas to use for the day! The Happy Bright Green was a contrast to the rainy Grey skies and turned a wet day into a HOLIDAY!!! We had a great time in Sydney, riding all the trains, Ferries, and buses and Holiday Inn Potts Point - Sydney gave us a nice place to recharge.

Reviews.Title: “2 nights at the Holiday Inn Potts Point Sydney”
Reviews.Author: tevorolevu
Reviews.Content: Reservations and emails communications were handled promptly. We needed a place for 2 nights as we were then travelling south. Yes the rooms seem a little dated compared to some other city hotels. We had a standard breakfast buffet in the ground floor restaurant which was fine. Our room overlooked the Kings Cross - Coca Cola sign. As this is King's Cross after all it was somewhat noisy but this is not fault of the hotel. The bathroom seems to have undergone a renovation quite recently and was quite spacious. I don't recall a mini bar in the room. Bathroom amenities were few in number. The plus is that it is conveniently located in the Cross - so if you are into music and bars etc. it is a great . The train station is also closeby if you come in that way. I wouldn't mind a few more stations and movies on the TV. Overall I can't say we had any issues with this short stay. Staff were efficient and friendly. We need a special receipt printed when we checked out - both names etc - and the staff member was very helpful and patient and assisted us. Thank you for the say Holiday Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Suited our purpose.”
Reviews.Author: Durhamlady13
Reviews.Content: Because we visited Sydney on a very busy weekend we ended up staying a few nights here and there and had to ditch our usual standard hotels (fully booked or no discounted rooms available) and explore the market a bit more. The Holiday Inn does tend to lean on it's Potts Point address when in actual fact it is smack in the middle of Kings Cross,an area that is very colourful and which comes alive after midnight and is not a cosmopolitan district like the harbour etc. There are plenty of shops, supermarkets and cafes and it's easy to walk into the city or take the train. This is a sit and watch the world go by area!! The Holiday Inn reminds me of the UK Travel Lodge or Premier Inn - decent rooms with no frills at a good price. We couldnt find anything to complain about but nothing to rave about other than it was clean and adequate for our couple of nights stay.This could have turned into one of those "What have we done" senerios but to be very honest it suited our purpose and it wouldnt put me off recommending it as long as your expectations aren't too high.

Reviews.Title: “Renovate This Place Now”
Reviews.Author: Vinylstatistics
Reviews.Content: I was booked into this hotel by the company and insisted that they never do so again. Whilst I can't fault the front desk and basic but airy foyer the experience will go downhill once the lift doors open on whatever tired old floor you have been put on. The room smelt of vegetable soup and whilst it was well equipped the only good thing was the air conditioning - it was +35 in Sydney. Bed was comfortable but i spent the waking hours wandering if i was sharing it with anything. Bathroom was clean but like the rest of the hotel, on its last legs. Decor is beige and boring, totally uninspiring. That said if you want easy access to the Red Light District, this will be right up your alley! Facilities are just adequate. The Gym is a converted room, give it and this poor hotel a miss.

Reviews.Title: “Well Located to Eastern Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Wolin
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Potts Point is conveniently located above Kings Cross train station. From here you are a short ride into the Sydney CBD and connections to the airport and anywhere in NSW. The hotel is in the middle of the Victoria Street restaurant and backpacker party scene. A very good location if you are young and looking for fun. Our room was on the third floor and had a lovely view of St Mary's Cathedral and the city skyline. The room was large with a very nice marble bathroom. Everything was clean. Staff were friendly and efficient. Across the road and down a bit is a liquor store as well as a Laundromat and dry cleaner. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but unfortunately in King's Cross precinct”
Reviews.Author: silkcashmere
Reviews.Content: Service was exceptional especially from the front desk staff. Rooms were comfortable and good (however the walls are a tad too thin to make oneself privy to audio from adjacent rooms). The only let down was the fact it was in the King's Cross vicinity which meant weekend nights were a nightmare ( to be fair though the hotel is located above the KC train station which makes it a convenient option in terms of transport, but not one for a quiet or family type of soujourn).

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, and no surprises!”
Reviews.Author: Lugill
Reviews.Content: WE stay here alot as it is near station to get to city or wherever, and has security parking on site. It is fairly quiet and the beds are comfortalbe with pillow menu! Handy to eastern suburbs, and quite a few reastaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: VancouverWomble
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 10 nights and were not disappointed. The staff are very accomodating and friendly. The Kings Cross tube station is next door which makes getting around the city a breeze and returning after a busy day out and about. The hotel is showing its age a little being an older one...the carpets are dirty in places and need cleaning or replacing. The beds are fine and we slept really well, except for the weekends when the noise goes late into the early mornings. It seems like all of Sydney comes to Kings Cross on the weekend to party! The rooms are of a nice size with a large bathroom.The area is somewhat seedy but we were never felt uneasy and got used to it after a few days. The best part of the hotel is the amazing breakfast buffet....which is out of this world for value....I recommend it!! Over all we enjoyed our stay here...just take earplugs for the noisy weekends and you will be fine. Its a decent 3 star hotel. If you want an internet connection save your money and go around the corner to the local Mc Donalds it has free wifi and just fine for checking your email or departure flight times! And if you are staying here for a while and need to do laundry there is a guest laundry room, which is a great help: $2 for a washer and the same for a dryer and the hotel provided soap for free!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location for an active tourist”
Reviews.Author: travelingchef33
Reviews.Content: the hotel was nicely located to many restaurants and nite life. the rooms were of moderate size and clean. there were eating options provided by the hotel, which were alright. did love the fact that the hotel was near by the subway station and the tour buses (hop on hop off types) which allowed us to move around the city inexpensively:) staff was very friendly and accommodating to our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Good 3 star.”
Reviews.Author: joolaaaree
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 days early October. Check in fast and friendly. We asked for a room facing the harbour, bridge and opera house as some face a busy road. The room had an amazing view. Ask for one of these. Other than that its a perfectly fine, clean 3 star. I would stay again if I got the view facing room as you get a view that would normally cost more. Enjoy- Sydney is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: PegasusDVM
Reviews.Content: Stayed there about 2 weeks ago. It's in an excellent location to basically do anything you could want. The Kings Cross train station is just next to the front door of the hotel. Very easy walk to downtown as well. The hotel was extremely clean. Nothing special as far as design, but great views. I agree with some of the other reviews - the beds were rather firm and clearly on the older side. Not to say it was uncomfortable, but could use an update. The staff was outstanding in all regards. The hotel is just off of the red light district, so the bar/patio was fun to relax. It's then completely worth walking up and down the streets (especially in the evening) because it really is quite an entertaining experience. Also, they had zero problems with an early checkin (in our experience, no charge) as a passenger from North America.

Reviews.Title: “lovely welcome”
Reviews.Author: KRogersZ
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay here. 3 kids and 2 adults. Queen and single bed in each room, so comfy, choice of pillows. Lovely and clean. Staff so very friendly and amenable, restaurant with simple menu, but cost effective and good food. Kids eat free with adults....breakfasts are wonderful...with chef to make pancakes/omelettes on demand and a huge buffet of continental and cooked choices. Hotel more in Kings Cross, so handy for the tube, and whilst we had a view of a night club door i was quite enthralled for a time. Earplugs needed. Loved it, would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “room with a view”
Reviews.Author: kaz188
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a weekend for mine and a girlfriend's birthdays. location is fantastic, close to shops, restaurants, pubs/clubs and kings cross station. we were allocated rooms facing the harbour bridge so it was relatively quiet as the rooms were not facing victoria st. would have been nice if they had a pool. have to buzz reception to get in and out of the carpark, instead of just giving us access on our room key.

Reviews.Title: “Great welcome followed by good service”
Reviews.Author: duwirri
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, clean and well furnished room with desk and lounge chair with choice of firm or soft pillows. Fixded line and wireless broadband at your desk.. Pleasant restaurant /bar and the menu had an adequate range of meals. Plenty of variety. The conference rooms were well setup with a sunny courtyard adjacent which was handy for those urgent phone calls out of earshot of the business meeting. The beverage service and snacks were great, the conference table water etc topped up at each break.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it!”
Reviews.Author: Bumbi17
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine. Nothing very extra, but very good location, superb staff, fair rooms. Note that the opposite street is the red light district. Okay, it is noisy, but it is not disgusting or anything, more funny! Also reasonably priced, so go!

Reviews.Title: “New beds please!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: RBH58
Reviews.Content: Have stayed there twice this year. It's a great location even if there is nothing really special about the hotel. On both occasions we were given a rooms with a great view of the city, the bridge and the opera house. On both occasions though, we were given the most uncomfortably worn out matresses I can ever recall in a hotel. Even if you get nothing else out of a hotel, the one thing you want is a decent night's sleep and with the state of the beds at this hotel, that's just about impossible. Please...please...please hotel management....it's time to do something. The beds are disgraceful.

Reviews.Title: “Smells ggod, looks good...Is "good"”
Reviews.Author: LittleAnnieM
Reviews.Content: Was here with work. Clean rooms, quick check in, Standard breakfast. This is in the heart of Kingscross: for visiters this is a VERY busy night spot with clubs, bars & MANY strip clubs etc. That being said it's got a train station right next door & you can walk to town with ease. Loads of places to eat around. The rooms are small, but clean & the same goes for the bathroom. Good foxtel channels...Oh If you can get a courner room (the bathroom has a little window above the bath: great hight to put things on while in the shower & for all the ladies - natural light to put on make-up: perfect!)

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and good location but just 1min away from nightlife!”
Reviews.Author: SporeSamSeng
Reviews.Content: I stayed in business for a couple of days and found this hotel to be next to a metro station entrance (Kings Cross). Perfect for traveling around in the subways. There's a rather small sized Coles supermarket opp the hotel and if you needed more, you can walk down the street (of night lifes) and reach Woolworths. My rates came with breakfast and was quite good. Given Sydney's standard, I think this is quite value for money. There's a $12 shuttle bus that runs between the front of this hotel (via some hotels) to the airport. You can pay for this ticket either from the drivers directly (mostly stopping infront of this hotel probably as a end point) or purchase from the convenience store nearby. When I arrived, it was way too early before the shuttles and had to take a taxi that cost around $50 AUD (with all the surcharges). But taxis in Sydney are all very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: MrMuppi
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 8 days whilst away for work. On check I asked for a room located on the top floor so I had a nice view considering I was going to be there for over a week. No room was available at the time, so I checked into my assigned room. But they arrange to move me to another room on top floor whilst I was at work the next day. Came back and everything had been sorted for me. The location is good. If you want night life of the Cross its right there, or if you want the nice stroll through the Royal Botanical Gardens they are close by. I also walked to the CBD with no dramas. But there is a underground train station basically next door if you want public transport. The Breakfast is awesome. I think better then some 5star hotels that Ive stayed at. Plenty of other restaurants and Coles is across road, so you will never go hungry. Rooms and bathroom are clean. Staff and guests are friendly. I used the gym every night, its small but has everything you need including chilled water and fresh towels. There is a fitness first across the road for the serious gym junky. Pleasant overall, became my little home away for home for the week.

Reviews.Title: “Great Sydney Views”
Reviews.Author: Rosscoe68
Reviews.Content: Stayed over night in August 2011, room was comfortable, bed was great, staff friendly. The highlight of the room was the view overlooking the city, the bridge and the opera house. Great value and would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: barretjl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in May 2011 for two nights prior to starting a Contiki tour. I got a great rate through Contiki so I wasn't sure how the quality of the hotel would be. I was pleasantly surprised when I arrived! The rooms are large and very comfortable. There are both firm and soft pillows on the beds for you to choose from, which is nice. I had a room on the 2nd floor (I think) and the noise from the street was audible. Since the hotel is located right in the nightlife district, there are people on the street at all hours (really - I woke up at 8am on morning and there were people out from the night before!). I had a problem with the ceiling above the shower dripping (probably from the room above). It wasn't annoying enough to warrant a call to the front desk, but it could have been more of a problem had I stayed longer. The location is really good - I was able to walk all over the city with no trouble. When I wanted to take the train/bus to Bondi, the front desk staff was super helpful in helping me figure out how to do it. Internet was really pricey (somewhere in the range of $28 for 24 hours of wireless in room), but I think it was free if you went down to the lobby. Breakfast was included in my rate and was also very good. Definitely recommend. The location, rooms, and helpful staff make it hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: melb7
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean in a good location with the train station basically underneath the hotel. I was in a basic room on the ground floor at the front of the building and could not hear the train or passing traffic. Reception staff were friendly and efficient. My only complaint with them was not being told that breakfast was included meaning I wasted time looking for something else in the surrounding streets at 7am. Very good value for the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice view, quiet, yet close to nightlife”
Reviews.Author: Melb0urnians
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights during the Queen's Birthday long weekend, and we really enjoyed it. Our room has the view of Opera House and the Harbour Bridge, and Sydney tower. It is right above the train station, and close to night life as well. But because our room is at the back facing the backstreet, we didnt hear any noise at all. During our stay it was always raining, The staff was friendly and offered us to use an umbrella. For those who rent a car, go straight to the car park which you need to press the buzzer.

Reviews.Title: “A good little hotel room.”
Reviews.Author: mantisalive
Reviews.Content: We had a room overlooking the Coke Sign which was cool. You can have a few drinks while watching the night get started, which is interesting at kIngs cross! Room was comfy & fine for what we paid. The toilet wouldnt flush properly and we had to ring reception 3 times to get it sorted out. They were quick, but the problem ended up being low water pressure in the building. Check in/out was quick and easy, and parking was fine. Bed was comfy & we had late checkout which was great. Overall good little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good view of Opera House from a distance”
Reviews.Author: Fahmi_Jakarta
Reviews.Content: Good location and nice view, closed to a shopping center, make it easy to find foods whenever required. We can see Opera House and Harbor Bridge from the Hotel window. It will not suitable if we come with family and or children, since it also located in the red lamp area of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “great location, but moderate hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stoks
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel and, like last time, I very much appreciated the service upon check-in: arriving on an early morning flight there was a room available even at 9 am! And the view was fantastic, overlooking the famous opera building, harbour bridge and down town skyline. My room did, however, not have a coffee maker (maybe more luxurious rooms did, though). And internet rates were really extremely expensive (AU$28 for 24 hr and extra costs when over 200 Mb data transfer). Breakfast was fine, with enough choices to pick from, although there should be more than one cook during rush hour... The furniture in the breakfast / dining area gives a "cheap" impression but in the bar section sofas are comfortable and service is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good value business hotel”
Reviews.Author: rayser46
Reviews.Content: I stay on business trips often. Good value close to most things.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service, location ok”
Reviews.Author: catman52
Reviews.Content: Totally no recognition as a priority member.INternet 28 $ per day !!!, 1.5 % credit card charge....Restaurant ok, will not come back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: steve420
Reviews.Content: A good hotel if you are staying in or near the Kings Cross nightlife area. Parking is $25 per day and it is next to the tube station. Rooms are spacious and the views good. Try to avoid the lower floors as the nightlife continues into the very early hours, also, avoid the top floor (8) as the air conditioning towers on the roof are quite noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Does the Job”
Reviews.Author: Emeste22
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Potts Point is a popular hotel for tourists, business people and air crew. It's a busy hotel always. The average room is basic but spacious and clean. Some rooms have amongst the best views in Sydney of the CBD skyline and the harbour bridge. The dining room is efficient with good quality food and reasonable pricing. The small bar area is relaxing and fun too. The area around the hotel is good to explore withsome history as well as excellent restaurants nearby. Don't be put off by the eclectic mix of people and the nearby proximity of Sydney's colourful and slightly seedy night life.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE Reservation Staff and Room left not make up”
Reviews.Author: meowmeow22002
Reviews.Content: TERRIBLE! Please do not trust those earlier good reviews about them! As you can see from some reviews about them, they are willing to provide Harbour View room ONLY SIMPLY OUT OF GOOD WILL and not what they argued later as it was for their Platinum members. OR IT IS ONLY FOR PEOPLE OF THEIR SAME RACE AND NATIONALITY! We are treated badly at the reception and when the RUDE Chinese male reservation staff came out, he just simply sneered at our request and denied that they promised to try their best to provide us the Harbour View room earlier during our booking and said it can only be done with a AU$40 extra. THIS IS POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE! My travel agent had booked with them about 2 and a half months ago with that promise, if not we would not have to choose this hotel for a 3 NIGHTS STAY. There are way too many good and great location hotels near CBD and Chinatown! As for their housekeeping, it is simply stupid to have a tag with â€œPlease do not disturbâ€� on one side and â€œPlease make up the roomâ€� on the other side! OUR ROOM ARE LEFT NOT MAKE UP ON THE 2ND DAY OF THE STAY, and they only simply apologised for their uselessness! This shows that they are simply not serious in doing the business with Rude and Incompetant reception staff! So, think twice again when you are planning a trip to Sydney because it does spoil our mood and had bad impression of Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Shaddy area - Kings cross...Ok hotel in a not ok location”
Reviews.Author: Maxximus99
Reviews.Content: Hotel was ok....did not expect much anyhow...try to get a room overlooking the opera in a distance, and harbour bridge.....Internet is charged, which is ridicolous..breaskfast was good..from eggs up to fresh orange juice, which you hav to make it by yourself..:))....Hotel is situated next to kings cross, which can be very loud during the end of the week..and sometimes dangerous...lot of drunk people, and guy people as well....I would NOT pick this hotel next time....sorry.....

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean and comfortable but feels like a 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: kho777
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for one night at an amazing 99 dollar deal because our apartment's shower was being repaired and could not be used for 24 hours. Parking is charged extra, but even then, it might be slightly difficult to find parking after 9 PM as there would be no spaces left. Bear this in mind if parking is important to you. Staff is exceptionally friendly and very helpful in general. However, upon entering the room, there is an inexplicable smell of possibly cleaning agents that can't seem to go away, but not annoying though. Room and bathroom are clean and well maintained. Bed and pillows are fluffy. Flat screen TV. A very standard hotel but the room feels like a 3 star hotel's. Location is fantastic and the noise from nearby nightclub district of Kings Cross could not be heard from your room which is a very good thing. Although I would suggest that you bring silicon ear plugs with you always when you're traveling. Overall, a comfortable stay and would probably come back for the aforementioned price of 99 dollars per night

Reviews.Title: “Great Base for our family holiday”
Reviews.Author: CraigDalina
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I have provided feedback on my stay but I really felt compelled to share my experience. When I told my family we were staying at the Holiday Potts Point on our visit to Australia they were not bothered either way, but by the end of our stay (5 nights) the level of comfort we had with the staff made it feel like home and we all wanted to stay longer. but it was not just the people but what a great location. My wife and I really enjoyed our morning walk which involved walking arouond Lady Macquaries Chair. The walk a brisk 40 minutes gave us some of the most spectacular views of the Opera House, Botanical gardens and Harbour Bridge. Ourside the hotel were numerous restaurants and cafes which provided interesting conversation as we chose our daily lunch. And finally the hotel sits right over Kings Cross railway station. In less then 10 minutes you can be shopping in Pitt Street Mall. and we did a bit of that. Being a family from the United Kingdom we found our time in Australia a wonderful experience and wish to thank the team at the Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent position, fantastic view, helpfull staff.”
Reviews.Author: Dewberry07
Reviews.Content: We were given a room with a fantastic iew of the harbour. The rooms were well appointed and clean. All staff were helpful, especially the Receptionists.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: shaquelle_la_01
Reviews.Content: I did stay in that Holiday Inn because I had to look on the prize, but I wanted to have one of these chain hotels. All other hotels were really high, so I have choosen this one, It is located in Kings Cross, where you get bunch of bars and restaurants. They have given me aroom with a view to the bridge and opera. The room itself was ok, decent size and quiet for sleep,

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Urs-Bob_CH
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very convenient located next to Kings Cross and only meters away from the metro station "Kings Cross". Despite in the center of party district the hotel is not noisy. Comes very well equiped in the bright rooms and you definately should not miss the enormeous breakfast buffet which makes a brilliant start. - The restaurant is convenient but during dinner you get freezing cold because of the air conditioning. Therefore the food was getting cold very quick.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Firedrag500
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a World youth day tour, check in was ok for a group of our size, the rooms were clean and quite spacious, the restaurant was a bit odd in my humble opinion, it was a sitting area just off reception but well designed, light and airy with a good selection of hot and cold food and beverages. You have to pay to use the internet in the business centre and there is no gym onsite instead you are given free use of the gym across the road. Overall a nice hotel with nice staff fit for the purpose we travelled for

Reviews.Title: “Average Holliday Inn hotel”
Reviews.Author: wirpool
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated about 20 min (walking) away from City centre of Sydney. It is just 2 min away from the metro station King Cross and just in the centre of Sydney night live. It is very noisy place and if you a business traveler it might not appropriate place to stay because there are two big roads and VERY nosy at night from Fri to Mon. This areas is also famous in Sydney for drugs and drunk people fighting. So, if you are not want to have a trouble with noise during night time and realy not into clubbing, I would recommend you to stay away from this drug and drunk people area and this hotel, especially if you travel with family and kids.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, convenient, Safe”
Reviews.Author: Saffa7441
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I needed to stay over recently in the city. Holiday Inn Potts Point was so convenient, right next door to the train station, so we didn't even need to waste money on cabs. The beds were so comfortable and the rooms have great views of the harbour bridge. The breakfast in the morning was wonderful - everything on offer and very yummy! The staff are helpful, friendly and fun! Nice vibe, nice atmosphere - not your typical stiff hotel, but all the staff are having fun at work - was nice to see and great to get lots of smiles and "hello's" from everyone! Definitely a good spot and we will be back - our new spot for overnights in the city!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Kings Cross railway station and buses to city with harbour views”
Reviews.Author: Maturity
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 8th floor with terrific views to the Harbour Bridge and Opera House. The hotel was well situated for the many small ethnic restaurants which abound in Potts Point. It is close to Kings Cross railway station and buses stop just across the road. Service was excellent and soft/firm pillows provided. Anything we requested was delivered very quickly. Only problem was a queen size bed and we would ask for a king size in future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ScooterLarry
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here in Mid March, before catching a flight back to San Francisco. We noticed a lot of flight crews were staying here. Room 716 was quiet, clean, and roomy enough for two. Bed was clean and comfortable, and came with both soft and firm pillows. Plenty of good hot water in the shower. Bonus was being able to see the Opera House in the distance. Although there were no cabs in que at the hotel, it was easy to flag one down at the nearest intersection. The area to the east of the hotel has many nightclubs, so that street was jumping on Sat. night when I walked to the McDonalds for a snack. Friday evening we followed the front desk's suggestion, and walked to the south to an vibrant area with many folks dining at the many varied restaurants. Only drawback was sticker shock at the price of the room, and the cost of wi-fi. But I guess that's the going rate for Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Basic and functional, but it's like sleeping on a raincoat!”
Reviews.Author: tallaght01
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel. I stayed for 2 nights while in Sydney for a course. It's pretty drab looking, but that kind of thing wouldn't really bother me. There's a supermarket across the street, and lots of eateries close by. my main gripe was the bed linen. I've never even thought about bed linen before, as I have pretty basic tastes. But the pillowcases and duvet cover were made of some non-absorbent fibre, which is probably easy to launder, but is very uncomfortable to sleep on. Right next to the train station aswell, which is handy. Other than that, basic and functional hotel. Bit steep at roughly $200 per night, though.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable, friendly, well located....”
Reviews.Author: Swansforever
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights in February - a Saturday and a Sunday night. We had a double room with a queen bed on the 3rd floor. It was on the quiet side, with views of the Harbour Bridge, the Domain park, and the Opera House. There were some water glimpses. The room is very quiet - no noise at all from outside, corridors or neighbouring rooms. The room and fittings are older but perfectly functional and clean. It is a very reasonable size. The bathroom is very large with extremely hot water almost instantaneously. The TV is flatscreen but the picture is stretched. There were some satellite TV stations, including sports and news stations. Breakfast was very good - fresh with lots of choice. The spinach and smoked salmon omelette was excellent. The location of the hotel is excellent - close to transport, walking distance to the city or Double Bay (for upmarket shops, good coffee shops and leafy streets with lovely houses). The staff were very helpful and friendly, we did not encounter a wait for service at any stage. There were only two minor criticisms of the room - the bed was a bit saggy and the curtains did not completely block out all the light (there was a crack along one side). However neither of these things really affected our stay that much - certainly not enough to worry about. I would recommend the Holiday Inn for a comfortable, reasonably priced stay in Sydney. We have already made 2 more bookings.

Reviews.Title: “good bed and quiet harbour view room”
Reviews.Author: yvakat
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 night in this hotel as a start for our 2 week Australia trip, and found it having a very convenient location (has also a garage to park your car), it's an easy 20 min. walk to the Sydney opera house, the staff is also very friendly and helpfull , good choice in breakfast, try the fresh juices; we had a room with harbour view, the furniture could indeed use some updating but the bed was really good and the room quiet, all in all we found it to have a fair (for Australia) price/quality level .

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: jotheringman5
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a good quality room at the back of the hotel. This gave us a view of Sydney Harbour Bridge and shielded us from any noise at the front of the hotel. The room was comfortable and a reasonable size. The staff at reception were very helpful, in particular on our arrival as we arrived at checkin at 8:30 am and were allowed to occupy our room immediately, even though normal checkin time was 2pm. A highlight of the hotel was the quality of the breakfast, where there was a great variety on offer in particular the wonderful juicer.The attached Sirocco restaurant served good food, though the menu was a bit limited and didn't change during our 6 days there. The only negative point was that access to the internet was quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Please Clean The Windows”
Reviews.Author: Calbarry
Reviews.Content: For the price the HI represents good value in Sydney. We had a "harbor view" room with a view that, with clean windows, would have been superb. However, I have never seen windows with so much dirt on the outside. Seriously, which decade were these last cleaned? The carpet in hallways and rooms is also a few years past their 'best before, dates as is the room furniture. However, we found the service very good and recommend the excellent breakfast buffet. The hotel is located at the doorstep to the infamous Kings Cross district and right on top of the subway for excellent access to to the Sydney attractions. Kings Cross is interesting in itself with a cross section of the seediest of Sydney and also some very nice little restaurants. Just keep to your right when you leave the hotel otherwise you may end up somewhere you don't want your kids to see. I woke up in the middle of the night on two occasions and watched the drunken 'entertainment' down below and would not recommend venturing out in the wee hours. Overall worth the money by expensive Sydney standards but ask for a room with clean windows if they have one.

Reviews.Title: “Bennelong King Suite - best value view (and room!) in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: AndyChiara
Reviews.Content: Looking for a hotel room where I could have some pre-party drinks (and post-party strippers) on my hens night, I chose the Holiday Inn due to it's great location: it is smack bang in the centre of the Kings Cross night and strip club district, a short walk to the Oxford St stretch (unbeatable Sydney gay nightlife) and very close to quite a few indie drinking holes of both the Darlinghurst and Surry Hills variety. In a word, top location for any party animal. I was not expecting much (considering the price we paid - AU$450) but the room was - in a word - incredible. Massive entry hall, moving in to a spacious living area (with 2 3 seater couches and 6 seater dining table), large fully functional kitchen (strangely unfurnished...we brought all plates and cutlery with us), large king bedroom and 2 bathrooms. Also, 2 60cm plasmas (one in the living area and one in the bedroom). The room appeared to have been recently renovated and was spotless. Did I mention the view? The entire front wall of the room's living area (more than 7m) is large glass windows, providing sweeping views of Sydney Harbour (including Bridge and Opera House) and over the CBD, Hyde Park, St Mary's Cathedral and the terraces of inner East Sydney. Glorious. There are also large windows - again providing panoramic views - from the bedroom. The room was such a surprise as the website provides absolutely no indication of what to expect (and neither do Holiday Inn staff: I phoned a few days prior to enquire as to whether the room had a microwave and was told no, when it indeed did). The room is spectacular: bloody huge, bloody good view, and bloody cheap. Not sure why the Holiday Inn are keeping this place such a secret, but trust me, i've started spreading the word! On a side note, I was unaware of the Holiday Inn policy of 4 people per room maximum at all times (I was of the view visitors were unlimited until 10pm like most other Sydney hotels), however, management decided to "let it slide", as long as we were out by 2100hrs (which we duly were). If you are considering having an event in the room, I suggest you canvas it with Holiday Inn staff in the first instance, as I should have!

Reviews.Title: “Favourite hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: golfinchick
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel several times, whilst there are other hotels closer to the city we are more impressed with this hotel than others. Firstly you get the wonderful views without the Sydney price tag! Also it is right next door to Kings Cross station so travelling is a breeze. The staff are all very friendly and the beds are exceptionally comfortable (hard to find in a hotel) Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and grubby”
Reviews.Author: flyingfrankie
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with the standard of room we received on our recent stay at this hotel. We clearly had been given the worst room in the hotel despite booking 2 months in advance and paying a standard non-discounted rate. The room was small, very dark and felt "grubby". The sort of carpet you don't want to take your shoes off to walk on. The passage way leading to the room also felt dirty and run down. It really felt no better than a 3 star hotel (at best). We were next door to the gym and could hear the tv blarring through the walls. I understand all hotels have less desirable rooms - but surely these should be offered at discounted rates and be left for last minute bookings.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but next to the bar / adult store / backpacker area”
Reviews.Author: pachachuck
Reviews.Content: ~ Hotel room and staff were fine. Restaurant/coffee shop downstairs pricey but good. ~ The laundry room is on the first floor. I put in our laundry and went to the coffee shop for a 'cuppa' while it washed. Ditto for drying. ~ Our room faced the street and was fairly quiet. No problem ~ Internet is expensive at the hotel. Sit in the lobby for free internet and check your email, etc. or go to any of the nearby coffee shops. ~ Lots of fast food places and only a few regular restaurants nearby. We found all of them expensive. $10-15 for simple breakfast!!!, more for lunch and dinner, $5+ for coffee! and that was in a backpacker coffee shop! (These kids must be rich!) ~ There is a grocery store about a block away (ask at the front desk) ~ The subway is right next door KINGS CROSS station: Take any train to TOWN HALL and change to the J or K for CIRCULAR QUAY for the Opera House & waterfront. ~ There's also several buses that stop 1 block away. 15-20 mins to the CBD (not counting time waiting for the bus <grin>). ~ It's next to the Potts Point bar and adult entertainment area. A bit up from sleazy but we did see a few drunk drag queens and bums. On Friday & Saturday evenings, the streets were very crowded and noisy. Lots of backpacker hotels/hostels in this area.... ~ Would recommend the hotel but would not stay there again due to the area it's in.

Reviews.Title: “Proof that Holiday Inns can be good”
Reviews.Author: ToshKent
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Sydney for New Year so it's difficult to gauge value for money but we were very pleased to find that we had a Bridge and Opera House view (albeit distant) which was great. The general condition of the room was very good and quite spacious - a cut above what you'd normally expect from a HI hotel. The location didn't bother us although the first evening we did turn left and found ourselves right in the red light area. We soon learnt to take a cab down to the restaurants. The staff were very good considering the pressure they were regularly put under by arriving and departing airplane crews who appeared to expect "finger click" service. The restaurant was particularly good. We came in from Christchurch on an early flight and the room obviously wasn't ready but the restaurant manager very kindly provided a much appreciated seat and some coffee. The breakfasts were also worth a mention and I'd suggest the chef from the Intercontinental take some lessons from the chef at this HI. The food in the buffet was always perfectly cooked and hot, the juicer was a really nice touch and was regularly cleaned out by staff who appreciated that carrot and orange don't mix. The manager and chef were very visible and approachable. All in all, this hotel proves that a Holiday Inn can actually be very good. Pity not more of them are.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Very good location and service.”
Reviews.Author: Jrs84
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Potts Point is a very good value hotel in a handy location. It is located right above the train station and you can walk easily into the city from there. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Room was spacious with a good view and a comfy bed. Very good four star hotel overall with reasonable cost parking, around $25 a night I think which is good value for Sydney city overnight. Would highly recommend as a place to base yourself in Sydney as it's walking distance to city or down to the water. It is not a luxury hotel but it doesn't claim to be. It's a clean, comfortable base in a great location with friendly staff and great views from some rooms. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: shed_gal
Reviews.Content: We travelled with a large group of soccer supporters (go Perth Glory!) and so we booked 40 rooms. Not one person in our group had a bad word to say against the hotel ranging from how good the rooms were to the excellent service from the staff. We travel away once a year and are often not welcomed at the larger chain hotels, but all the staff were polite and friendly. Many of us frequented the bar and had breakfast and all had positive feed back. Our twin room was large, comfortable and I always appreciate a pillow choice (as I personally prefer firm pillows) which was offered in the room. The location is excellent for all the night clubs, pubs etc in the area and there is so many places and food choices to eat close to the hotel. We had a function in the hotel and everybody raved about how great the food was and how professional the staff were. If we ever return to Sydney we will most definetly stay at this hotel and recommend that you do too.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff interesting location”
Reviews.Author: inchmurrin
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the hotel prior to a long cruise having been changed from a hotel closer to the harbour. The location more Kings Cross than Potts Point turned out to be a blessing. Virtually on top of the metro station and with good facilities close by the hotel suited our independent traveller approach. The staff were very helpful knowledgeable and very solution orientated helping us sort out a couple of tricky issues with credit cards and restaurants. The hotel was clean and well maintained. they look after Priority club members well make it well worth signing up.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, city centre is on walking distance”
Reviews.Author: ALiEN2108
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 4 nights. It's location is by the very entrance to the King's Cross so no worries about being in the "red light" district. We were able to walk to all Sydney City Center attractions by foot (we had a stroller for our kid though). When going a bit further on, subway station is only 20 steps away from hotel! Again superb! Breakfast was very good, but arriving on weekend they forgot to tell us it is up to 10:30 only on weekends, so we staid without breakfast on Monday. With a proper room, facing the harbor you will have very nice view of the Sydney parks and even the opera. Internet is EXPENSIVE (over $20/day), but so is in most of Australia I found out later. It really pays off if you opt for a pre-paid mobile Internet. You can get 4Gb/30days with USB Modem for as low as $50.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and very convenient to the City, public transport......everything”
Reviews.Author: DragonMelbourne
Reviews.Content: An early checkin-in was requested and Reception never blinked when we arrived even earlier than expected. Our room was comfortable with a beautiful view over the harbour and the city. Breakfasts offer many choices and the staff were charming. Holiday Inn Potts Point is directly over the underground train which connects to absolutely everywhere so it could not be more convenient. If you want to walk to the City it is an easy 10 minute walk, and another 5 minutes to Darling Harbour and all that is offered there. The staff, like most Australians, are all friendly and eager to assist to your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: juelles99
Reviews.Content: Potts Pointe is really nice and in an awesome location (also it's right above the subway). Take the train two stops to Bondi Beach! I got there before I could check into my room and the girl at the front desk gave me some awesome tips about where to go and allowed me to store my bags behind the desk as I spent the day walking around. Wireless internet is VERY expensive, don't plan on using your laptop here. There are tons of bars and restaurants around and I felt very safe. Very enjoyable stay at this Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: puntrd
Reviews.Content: Firstly, this is a really good place to stay. Reception friendly and effecient. Plenty of food options nearby and the bar was good, even though I only had one beer there, the guys were friendly and helpful. Room was nice. Unfortunate that I was given a room on the ground floor, but for a $130 a night mystery special on wotif.com, I didn;t mind. Bed was comfy. Annoying fire alarm message early in the morning which proved to be a false alarm. Better to be safe than sorry I suppose. Plenty of TV channels. My only gripe...and it's a big one...was that when I went to take a shower at 10am, the hot water was nonexistent. It was barely lukewarm and showering while shivering was less than ideal. I liked the hotel though. But the bathroom experience was pretty ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning views”
Reviews.Author: The_Meon_Meerkat
Reviews.Content: The views from the upper floors (on the right side) of this hotel are quite simply spectacular. By day you can see the harbour bridge and opera house and by night the downtown blocks are just as spectacular. You can make your buffet breakfast anything from a healthy fruit salad to heart attack city (or both if you're greedy/hungry) and there's a really neat juicer and tons of fruit for making freshly squeezed orange/apple/pineapple etc. The coffee is good too. And there are free papers which are great for folks travelling on their own with no-one to talk to except the friendly staff. The rooms are large and have personal controls for heating and cooling. Bathrooms are clean and modern, and furniture is reasonable quality and in good condition. The hotel lobby and public rooms are in good order. Lots of airline people stay here and it's said that Sir Richard Branson stays here when he is in town. The TVs get about 10 channels and are modern flat screen units. The local establishments include a lot of sleazy bars and sex venues alongside fast food outlets and many young people (Potts Point seems to be a backpacker destination) but I wouldn't say most people would feel intimitdated; young children might ask some awkward questions though. It all seems safe enough. There's (plenty of) pay parking below the hotel, but my rental car stayed in the car park for the whole stay because the hotel is so well connected and close to the city's attractions. One negative comment: the daily internet prices are unreasonably high, so if you have an alternative, then think about using that instead, or try to live without the internet for the duration of your stay. There is a complex charging structure based on minutes on line with a max. daily charge but also a download limit - all way to complicated for a short stay when many international hotels provide this kind of thing for a nominal daily charge or nothing. It's a shame as it takes the shine off an otherwise really lovely hotel experience. Here's the thing, the chairman of Sainsbury (a big supermarket chain in the UK) once said, his customers will get great value all year round from his stores but when asked, always mention the one rotten apple in a bag they bought from the store, not the thousands that were OK. I think the Holiday Inn would be advised to consider the implications of that in relation to their internet charges. Just my view though.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful - home away from home”
Reviews.Author: the_initials
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Holiday Inn Potts Point regularly for work, holding very regular meetings there. The hotel is cosy, with fantastic staff who go out of their way to help. They are always smiling and courteous, and friendly. The hotel has a variety of meeting rooms, with delicious catering. There is also a very nice restaurant, room service and cafe/bar area. The food is consistently very good, and the restaurant manager and staff are fantastic. The rooms are comfortable, some with magnificant harbour views. I am delighted to stay at this centrally located hotel and look forward to my next visit in a couple of weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money - Great Nights Sleep”
Reviews.Author: Bambooza
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed my stay here, the hotel appears to have been recently refreshed, so it has a nice new edge to it. The pillow menu is a nice touch, and contributed to a great nights sleep. The restaurant was good and meant I didn't have to venture out for a meal. Don't woryy about it being one street back from the centre of kings cross, you would'nt even know it from inside, plus easy to get travel options to move about the city. For families they do have two bedroom suites, which I wish I had known last year when we were in the city on our way overseas.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - harbour view room with stunning views”
Reviews.Author: Frenchtraveller8
Reviews.Content: Had two nights in a room with a huge curved window with stunning views of the city and harbour - what a picture! Expected the hotel to be a little out of the way but it wasn't - it was right at the top of Kings Cross with an underground train station within 50metres which was great - made getting around so easy. Also within reasonable walking distance of the city, The Rocks, lots of places. Didn't like Kings Cross at night so we hopped on the train and went to Darling Harbour where there were crowds of people dining, walking around and enjoying themselves. The place was hopping! Everything about the hotel was good - the room was bright, clean and roomy - the staff were very pleasant and helpful and the restaurant served a very nice steak - the breakfasts were good too - chef made a great omlette - even if it was very busy and hard to find a table on the second morning. We will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room, bed, clean”
Reviews.Author: PopMU
Reviews.Content: Room is excellent, very clean, good size. Breakfast was very nice. No complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Not super central, but lots going on nearby!”
Reviews.Author: DAL504
Reviews.Content: Trying to stay within work budget limits made this an easy choice. It wasn't super central, but not THAT far either. a quick 5 minute train ride to the center of Sydney was easy and there was a train station nearby that allowed us to get to our business meeting via train as well. The hotel was clean and comfortable - definitely no frills, but had decent views of the city on one side. The restaurant was pretty good for breakfast and it was near lots of lower end restaurants and take away places - seems like this area was popular with backpackers - mostly from other parts of Australia, but it did give it a pretty youthful feel while at the same time was pretty close (10-15 min walk) to some decent restaurants on the water. I did get a chance to use the workout room which had a decent amount of equipment. The wifi was a bit spendy and slow (but if you do any traveling in the South Pacific, you are probably used to that!).

Reviews.Title: “A Great stay with a great location....”
Reviews.Author: METAR
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Holiday Inn Potts Point on a very regular basis, probably on average 3-4 times a month. Without a doubt, this is one of the best hotels we have on our network of travels. The rooms are spacious and well appointed. The best feature in my opinion being the bed. I don't know what it is, but the beds there are some of the best beds I've slept in... and the duvets are a great touch. Most of the rooms are quiet, unless you get one by the gym (Rm 128-126) or the elevators. Half the rooms have harbour views over looking the Sydney Harbour and the Opera House. The location of this hotel can't be beaten, unless you want to pay more. The Kings Cross station is located right next door to the hotel. A 5 second stroll to the station entrance. Darlinghurst Rd and Kings Cross is a 10-15 second stroll away. The CBD is either a 10-15 minute walk away or a 5-6 minute subway ride.

Reviews.Title: “Fab stay”
Reviews.Author: josmon10
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Holiday Inn Darling Harbour a few days earlier, I found the HI Potts Point a much better option in Sydney. I was upgraded to a room with a view, and it was fantastic: the Opera House, The Bridge, The Botanic Gardens... from a distance, but with no buildings blocking the views. The area is also great for eating out, and even though it doesn't have a great reputation at night, I didn't find it dangerous at all. There's a tiny fitness room in the hotel with not even a locker room, but as a guest you have free access to the Fitness First gym opposite the hotel. Totally recommended!

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: tajandmark
Reviews.Content: we arrived here after a 30hour trip from the uk, check in was no problem however once we got to our room the key card wouldnt work, hardly the end of the world but it meant a trip back downstairs to get the key re coded. the room was pleasant, perfectly acceptable although no sooner had we opened our door we had some americans from down the hall barging their way into our room wanting to take us out to a party! anyway, once we'd got rid of them we ordered some room service (the burger and chips went down a treat) had a bath and off to bed, which was clean and comfortable. the hotel itself is approx 20minutes walk from the opera house, the restaurant wasnt great but we didnt stay here for the food, purely a stopover before heading up north. if the price is right we will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Place to Stay in Sydney, Australia”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellers123
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Kings Cross or Potts Point Stayed here for one night as part of the Contiki trip for Australia. Did one night in a quad share room in Sydney at the end of a big tour. The hotel was located in a good are of Kings Cross, which is the Red Light District of Sydney. Overall it was easy access to a good nightlife area and good eating places nearby. Subway was across the street and a good Mexican restaurant down the street. The subway station was just next door as well the taxi stand was just across the street, very good. Check in and check out process to the hotel was very quick and efficient. Staff were very friendly and specific to my needs at the hotel. Hotel had a fast elevator and was very clean in most areas. Room was very spacious, with very big and soft beds. Had a good desk and good selection of telephones. Good hot water was available from the shower and large selection of towels. The carpet was quite clean as you could safely walk barefoot on it. There was a nice balcony and a nice view of the Sydney Skyline from our room. Overall I would recommend this hotel to many people from backpackers to single people to about families as well. However since it is near Kings Cross, maybe not best place to bring children, I would look at a place somewhere else. But the hotel itself is very good and nothing to worry about.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Great”
Reviews.Author: candyapple01
Reviews.Content: Recent trip to Sydney ,to discover the Golden mile , the holiday Inn is very clean and the staff go out there way to make sure your ok, and its central to everywhere and you didnt need to use the car .Food is good and and drinks and nibbles are a must in the evening watching the night life. And the Kings Cross Hotel next door almost $10 steaks are a must , we have already thinking about going back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient if your moving around Sydney”
Reviews.Author: thecrankytraveller
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a good 30 times. I love the location as it provides easy access top and from the city, airport and out suburbs via the Easter Distributor. Whilst it's proximity to Kings Cross may be a concern I have never been concerned for my safety (so long as you are tucked up in bed by 11pm I think you are always safe here). There are a myriad of gread resturants within a 5-10min walk of the hotel (which is great as teh hotel restuarant is the usual bland fare). There is a train station directly accross the road. The hotel has been refurbished recently so teh rooms are reasonble fresh, bedding is good and room size fine. Try and request a harbour views room level 4 or above (this will give you great views back to the bridge). There is a gym on site which is fairly standard, for a more hardcore experience there is a larhe fitness first gym accross teh street. There is also a supermarket accross the street as well. Walking in the daytime is fine it is approximately a 20 min walk into the Sydney city centre. Note teh room has no mini bar service however with a liquor store and supermarket accross teh road this is actually a blessing.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good breakfast, check-in staff need a rev up”
Reviews.Author: flyboy2000
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a few times. Rooms are drab but beds/pillows comfortable and bathrooms spacious with decent showers. Internet only allowed me to download 200MB before telling me I had to start paying more or slow to a crawl. The more hotels that start offering free internet the better! (Kudos to The Quadrant hotel in Auckland for introducing it to the NZ market). Morning breakfast is good for under 20 bucks. My big issue was at check-in. Person was on phone dealing with a complaint - I waited over 5 minutes. Then he took another call and I had to wait another 3 minutes. Rule 1 of guest service - deal with the person standing in front of you, not the person on the phone!! A hotel this size should have at least two people at check-in and not expect them to double duty as a telephonist.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money”
Reviews.Author: onedaylikethis
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a 'secret' hotel room through lastminute.com, I was a bit nervous about this, but at $99 a night it was too good a deal to pass up. The hotel was great, the room was huge, with a view of the harbour and opera house. Also I was offered late check-out and a newspaper by reception which was a nice surprise. I will definitely be staying here next time I am in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: ellie188
Reviews.Content: Good location, near to the train station or a good 1 hour walk to the city centre, through the park & around the sea front. Make sure you have the breakfast buffet, its the best!!

Reviews.Title: “good location, bad crowd”
Reviews.Author: september3ph
