Reviews.Content: when choosing a hotel for business, location is the priority, so this one is perfect since it is in kings cross and beside the metro station. but being smack right in the heart of this district, there are a lot of rowdy drunk teens hanging about outside so the hotel has tightened their security at night and only guests with a key can enter, otherwise if you forget your room key, then they will get suspicious.

Reviews.Title: “A trip with friends..!!!”
Reviews.Author: MuhammadR1
Reviews.Content: we stay here for 1 week and enjoyed alot because every tourist want good services and there for that hotel have enough services and number of dishes...!!!!

Reviews.Title: “All girls out”
Reviews.Author: RoseMai
Reviews.Content: The staff are very helpful, clean rooms and food is nice. They know how to get the attention of kids who are not in the mood.

Reviews.Title: “Central Kings Cross Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ByronBay1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is more in Kings Cross than Potts Point with the main giveaway being the Kings Cross station right under the hotel. We were given a family room with 1 double and 1 single bed in the Family wing. The room was large and spacious and had been recently renovated. As stated above the hotel is directly above the Kings Cross station which can get you anywhere in Sydney. There are numerous restaurants, and takeaway places within a couple of minutes walk away. Dont use the interent at the hotel, we did but ended up finding an Internet area in the Coles centre just across the oad for $2 for 1 hour.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable hotel,excellent value for money.”
Reviews.Author: daisyherts
Reviews.Content: Although situated in the redlight district this hotel is very good value for money and offers real comfort for a stop over.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic View”
Reviews.Author: delboy14
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel, which we booked way back in April 09, mainly for the new years eve fireworks. When we arrived we were asked if we would like to upgrade to a Harbour view room. At first we declined but then changed our minds and boy are we glad we did. If you ever stay here pay the extra and get a Harbour view room with views of the bridge and opera house it is well worth the extra believe me. The Hotel, as others have said, is located in the Kings Cross area which apparently is renowned as Sydneys red light district at night and I wouldn't argue with that fact. It is also an area which is frequented by a few homeless persons which could make you feel uncomfortable. There are a LOT of backpacker hostels in this location and numerous internet cafes which is a far better deal than using the Hotel internet which is expensive at around $28 per 24 hours. Surprisingly the best eating place was the Bourbon & Beefsteak on the main street which has rump steak for $10 every day and happy hour from 6 to 9 when all drinks are $3 !!. We have to say the steak was one of the best we've had.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed Expectations”
Reviews.Author: PinotDude
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and have stayed at a lot of Holiday Inns for business. This one was pure pleasure--arrived the morning of New Year's Eve with my wife. The staff was young and enthusiastic; they always did the best they could even when they weren't really able to help. Good buffet breakfasts for those who care about that, clean rooms, and a stunning Harbor View for the New Year's Eve fireworks (worth the extra $$$ if you're considering that.) Way more lively and interesting neighborhood than staying in the CBD. Downsides--$27 a day Australian for internet service (they give you a single 20 minute free session daily downstairs, but that won't cover much) and a truly pathetic hotel gym--but on the other hand, they will give you a pass to use a perfectly good health club across the street; that enthustiastic staff doesn't get a lot of drilling on telling people about fees and features at check-in so you do have to be proactive and ask followup questions. Tip--If you're flying in, take a cab to the hotel---for a couple, it's only about $10-$15 more than you'd pay for the shuttle service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: flightattendant74
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a vibrant area, but still quiet, very close to trainstation Kings Cross and it is stylish, comfortable and absolutely clean. This place was an excellent choice for me as single tourist. I would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Good and good location”
Reviews.Author: simonsmidt
Reviews.Content: At Kings Cross this is a very well located hotel, modern and luxurious. We took a family room (385) for 310 AUD including breakfast. The room is big and new. Good beds were we made well use of because of our jetlag. We slept from 1700-0800. Breakfast was really good, a big buffet with plenty of choice.

Reviews.Title: “everything you could want”
Reviews.Author: megatom
Reviews.Content: First visit to Sydney and the location of this hotel couldn,t be better. Next to railway station with conecting trains, or a nice walk straight into town or the harbour area. Our room had a fantastic view looking over the Sydney bridge and Opera house. The room was large with a fridge, ironing board and iron,(which was a blessing as we had been on a cruise beforehand and our clothes definitly needed a press!! There is also a laundry room downstairs if you needed it. The staff on the front desk were great, very helpful (especially Hugh) gave us plenty of tips on where to go and how to get there. The retaurant had lovely breakfasts and the area is very colourful.. We enjoyed the "characters" in Darlinghurst Road , they didn,t bother you at all and it made for a very interesting stay. I would definitly stay here again as it ticked all the boxes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room.....EXCELLENT Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: sugar62866
Reviews.Content: We had a nice room with comfortable beds and plenty of space, full size closet, small refrigerator, etc, etc, but the best part of our stay at the Holiday Inn Potts Point was the staff. They were so helpful and friendly that I wouldn't think twice about staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: theheadland_7
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located about 3km from the CBD, in the with great views of city skyline. A city rail station is across the road - trains to city and bondi every 5 minutes, with hundreds of restaurants, cafes and bars and nightclubs within 5 minutes walk. The room was clean and comfortable - great beds and good strong shower. The staff are what makes the Holiday Inn special - they were all very friendly and competent - every request was promptly met. I attended for a work conference - the food was much better than the usual function fare. All of the other delegates were very impressed - especially by the excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - if you get a room with a view!”
Reviews.Author: bazandbabs24
Reviews.Content: Good hotel with very friendly staff. As a Platinum Priority Club member I was upgraded to a harbour view room which is well worth it - certainly made my day on my first visit to Sydney. The only issue I had with the hotel is the location - Kings Cross is probably not one of the nicest areas of Sydney and at night it did feel slightly uncomfortable walking around the area. Other than that, would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: ymt09
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Front desk staff are awesome as are the rest of the employees. Went out of their way to see that we were always taken care of. Rooms were nice with plenty of space. Internet was a bit steep though...in room cable for internet usage was $27.50 (Aus dollar) for a 24 hr period. Mc Donalds around the corner on Darlinghurst offers free wireless internet. The hotel is located in King Cross with many food establishments within walking distance. There is a red light district located within a block of the hotel with many strip clubs& liquor stores around. There are prostitutes as well as drug addicts hanging around on Darlinghurst however they were not a nuisance around the hotel. Location of hotel is just a few steps from the Kings Cross train stop so getting around Sydney was very easy from the hotel. Lots of backpacker hostels in the area as well if you are a backpacker. We will stay here again on our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “A great value and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: KAinCA
Reviews.Content: My family and I (my husband and 3 kids (10, 17, 22) stayed here for one week while vacationing for the first time in Australia. We had a very good experience. Because there were five of us, we had to rent two rooms (their rooms allow a max of 4). The rooms were roomy enough and quite comfortable. The housekeeping crew did a nice job of keeping our rooms clean. We were thoroughly impressed with the front desk staff. They were extremely warm and welconing. Dori, especially, was fabulous. My daughter left her Nintendo DS on the airplane and she did everything she could to try to help us contact the airline to retrieve the Nintendo. When we finally gave up on finding it, Dori delivered a note and gift bag to my daughter's room to try to cheer her up. Very sweet, and much appreciated. Dori went out of her way to make our stay more pleasant. While the buffet breakfast was really, really good, it was a little pricey ($20 AUD per person). The hotel is directly above the Kings Cross train station which was handy for us because we used public transportation the entire time. The area (really, it is right on the border of Potts Point and Kings Cross) definitely catered to backpackers and meant that the nights could get pretty loud with partiers. It wasn't too bad, though, we were able to sleep. The neighborhood also had a lot of bars and "adult" shops and theaters. Not really a big deal to us, we still thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Like comming home”
Reviews.Author: petruss
Reviews.Content: I had to organise a fathers day weekend ,for my two brothers and our sons, in memory of our own father who past away a few years ago. It was decided we would travel overseas for a extended weekend to Sydney . Many years ago (18 years ago) before my wife became seriously ill ,we came to this hotel for a honeymoon week , and a few years later with our two boys for a few days vac on our way back from Europe ,and then 4 years ago with my new partner . So i decided i would book it again and see how it would go . Well i can only say the standard of this hotel still seems to be maintained to a very good standard , everything is in excellent working order, the hotel apears to continually be upgraded .The staff faces change , but the service is still great and friendly. Breakfast is good, caters for all taste ,and it is always so great to be able to go down into the subway right next to the hotel front entrance . I stay in many 5 and 4 star hotels, at least 60 to100 room nights a year .( i travel on vacation for at least 3 to 4 months of year .And this is one hotel that continually gives me good memories of its good location ,and room layout. Shame you cant get rid of the noisy bird outside the window, But they do not destroy your stay , to many possitives to make up for nature . For me the hotel feels like home, and thats important for me as i spend so many nights on vacation each year . sadly the only thing lacking that i need ,and becomes the norm in most overseas hotels that i stay in now, Is FREE IN ROOM INTERNET , so can keep up with my business and friends whislt on holiday

Reviews.Title: “Good locale - great value”
Reviews.Author: Hulinea
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from two nights staying at this Hotel. Picked it up very cheaply as a secret stay on Need It Now for a total of $220.00. Had read about how noisy the first few floors could be, so was primed to ask for a room higher up and if possible some harbour view. Well we did very well - room 705 was the very end of the floor well away from the noise of Darlinghurst/Victoria Street and also had a bit of a view of the Harbour Bridge and back of the Opera House. Because it was the end room, also had more windows which was nice!! Service was great and with its proximity to everything including the Kings Cross station - a great central spot to be in.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, great views (additional cost)”
Reviews.Author: Kauai2007
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a typical Holiday Inn. We booked it during the low season and used a coupon. We "splurged" and paid more for a room with a harbour view, and we were glad that we did because the view was pretty amazing. Total, our room ended up costing about $80 per night. Location is right next to the Kings Cross subway station. That area is known to be a bit shady - we walked around a bit (mostly during the day) and did see a lot of scantily dressed people. But otherwise, no real problems. There seemed to be quite a bit of food options all around. Our room had a queen bed, bathroom was clean and lots of counter space. It was a pretty decent sized room. We were able to leave our bags in storage for a few hours after we checked out. There were also bathrooms in the lobby area which was convenient when we came back to pick up our bags before heading to the train station We weren't sure if we wanted to pay the extra $20 for the harbour view room, but it was worth it. You could see the bridge, the Opera House (was particularly neat b/c that week, they were reflecting images on the sails and we could see that), and the harbour. We loved the view so much that a few nights, we got take out food and just came back to our room to eat it.

Reviews.Title: “not in potts point”
Reviews.Author: jetlagsux
Reviews.Content: this great hotel is not in potts point. it's right in kings cross. the hotel room was nice and spacious and had a great, distant view of the sydney bridge and opera house. the only complaint were the toilets. they dont flush very well. i had to explain to my boyfriend why my poo was stuck in the toilet bowl after 4 flushes. but great location if you want to be near kings cross and backpacker central. it's also a good 30 minute walk to hyde park and the cathedral.

Reviews.Title: “Good value if you can get it”
Reviews.Author: alanst
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights when first arrived in Sydney. Its in a great location just near to the very lively Kings Cross area. Just into the new year it was very busy and usually fully booked and the prices went up for the big dates as is to be expected. So we only stayed a couple of nights. The hotel was clean quiet and comfortable. The room we had was small and cosy. Lots to do in the surrounding area and lots of good bars and eating places. All in all it was a good value hotel in a great location not far from the centre of Sydney by train ( 2 mins walk Kings Cross Station) or on foot about 15 mins walk to George street, the Opera House etc

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of it all”
Reviews.Author: enjoylife72
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn in Kings Cross ticks all the boxes you would expect for a business traveller. My only complaint was the street noise at night did not stop on the weekend until around 4am and then started up again at 6am!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, but don't use the laundry service and be careful with which rate you choose!”
Reviews.Author: gobitz
Reviews.Content: Hi I arrived to the hotel early morning - still i got a room (although official check in time is at 14.00 i think). The room was not great (first floor), but i was too jet lagged to complain. when i woke up, and asked if I was going to get a better room (usually Platinum members get upgraded) i was told i would have to wait another few days. But then I was given a great room on the 7th floor (harbour view) and took many amazing pictures of the sydney harbour bridge. It wasn't the exactly an executive, but the view does it all. One comment - don't send your laundry. It doesn't come back the same size and it costs a fortune! I did get a discount when i complained. ANother comment - they made a big mistake with my payment - even though it was a weekend rate (one night deposit on the time of booking), they pre charged me the whole week before I even arrived! I called and then they made a debit to my creditcard, but as you know the CC company only debits it one month later! very annoying. Breakfast is pretty basic - i've seen better. the nice thing is that you can make your own fruit juice and they do get you smoked salmon if you ask for it. For the rest there's not that much variety compared to other holiday inns i've stayed in (Singapore, Amsterdam, London). The gym e hotel is 24 hours. It has very few machines, but if you want you can get a free pass to fitness first!!! Worth it. The hotel employees really do their best to please you. I must say that they are really great. Especially Hugh! and Nick and Daniel also do their best to keep you happy. If their manager ever reads this, then you should give Hugh a raise cause he really makes you feel welcome. About the cleanliness: i don't think they clean that well - they surely don't use water to clean the floor, nor at other places. I found a hair behind the tab on the first day I moved into that room (not my hair), and when i checked out it was still there. Also there was some rubbish on the bathroom floor, and the same story - never cleaned. the next guest might enjoy that hair and rubbish.....

Reviews.Title: “Good central hotel in the heart of the action”
Reviews.Author: brunsky
Reviews.Content: Having lived in Sydney before, I knew I wanted to be around Dalinghurst or Potts Point as all the best eateries and bars are around there, and it's also centrally located for touristing around CBD, easy access to the North and the Eastern Suburbs. The hotel was a standard Holiday Inn, meeting all the expectations of the chain, very clean and friendly service. Fair value for money. A tad noisy on the King's Cross side, but I imagine perfect if you ask for a room facing the city (though they are probably more expensive given the views!). Would probably stay again, though next time I might opt for a beach location instead...

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable views, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ilana27
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights in March, and loved being there. The views of Sydney are fantastic. Make sure you book a Harbour View room, the extra cost is worth it! Location is very central, but the room was quiet and comfortable and the staff were extremely helpful. Breakfast was part of the package and very nice. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “World class view for a value price”
Reviews.Author: Lorne29
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything going for it. I read some negative reviews, but for me, this hotel is as good as it gets for the price. I found the hotel using TripAdvisor and got a great deal. The base price was about $105 US for a harbor view room. The hotel is not on the harbor, but the view is spectacular all the same. We were lucky and got a room on the top (8th) floor, but also saw the view from a 3rd floor room and it was equally great. The hotel is small enough that there was never a wait for the elevator. The lounge and breakfast area were easily accessible, and there was a nice outdoor area (just off the street) right off this area. We (my wife and I) opted for breakfast, which added about $20 US to the daily rate, and it was good value: lots of fresh fruit, good bread, hot items, eggs to order, good coffee, and more. Another benefit of staying at the hotel is that the King's Cross rail station is just a few steps away. You could easily leave your room and get to the train platform in about 3 minutes (we had rail passes which made the journey even faster), and the train connects easily to the main Sydney stations. The King's Cross area is busy and there are lots of nice, small restaurants. (There are also a number of "gentlemen's clubs" and "adult shops" on the next street over (Darlinghurst Road), but the atmosphere is still lively and the streets are clean and bustling with activity.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value”
Reviews.Author: muffin_buffalo
Reviews.Content: I came here for a night after a bad experience with the hostile my friends and I were staying in down the road. I travel to Boston and other cities with my family, so I'm used to pretty high prices for inner-city hotels, so this was priced very reasonably (less than AUS$200 per night) by my standards. Upon arrival and checkout the staff was very helpful and friendly, patient and understanding. I've usually had good experiences with people working at hotels, but this was one of the best. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. The bathroom was very nice. My only minor complaint would be that it does get a little noisy at night due to people in the streets until late, but that's sort of to be expected in a popular night spot in a large city.

Reviews.Title: “right in backpacker nightlife area & above King's Cross station”
Reviews.Author: disabled05
Reviews.Content: My gf & I stayed for 2 nights during 48-hour "see Sydney" layover. Took $12 shuttle bus from airport (note: their freebie tourguide book they give you at their stand includes a coupon to use with them; you could look for coupon before you pay). In retrospect I would have taken the train/subway from airport to King's Cross as the shuttle bus was disorganized and late and the train was fairly direct. Potts Point holiday inn is on same street as a ton of backpacker hostels and an adjacent street has all the nightlife (short short short skirts were in style). it was a cool fun area; i could've been everyone's dad but my gf and i went for a drink and a meal anyway and had a good time. i felt more at ease there than at the expensive shirt-n-tie establishments down by Circular Quay. We walked to the Opera House via the botanical garden; you can't get lost. It's about a mile. You can also take the train/subway from King's Cross to Circular Quay. Internet was with cable and worked but they charged you which sucked and it wasn't cheap. Phone was outrageous (6.44/min to call USA) so we got a phone card $10 for 1500 min and just paid $1.10 per local-call connect. A couple weeks in advance I had arranged with a local florist to deliver flowers to the room before we checked in and I had called their staff to ensure it would all work, and they said it would, but the flowers were not there when we entered the room. I called the desk and they said they had the flowers in their fridge. So, a couple points off for that but no big deal. Our room had a view of the Opera House (in distance).

Reviews.Title: “Great view”
Reviews.Author: laurapoo80
Reviews.Content: Ended up at this hotel having arrived in Sydney the day before Australia Day, turning up at a disgusting hostel, walking out and then wandering aimlessly trying to find accommodation! This hotel was so clean and modern and the room was spacious with a spotless modern bathroom. We were lucky enough to have a huge window with a view down to the harbour bridge. Also, the pillows on the beds were amazing and the comfiest i have ever had! The hotel is in a good location as it is right in Kings Cross and opposite the station. Would definitely stay here again - great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal for the Price”
Reviews.Author: EARWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: We were traveling to Sydney from Thailand for New Years Eve and found that most of the hotels on the Circular Quay were either booked solid or were charging ridiculous prices. So we came across the Holiday Inn Potts Point and gave it a try. First, for the time of year that were in Sydney the prices were great. The Hotel is clean and actually not that far from all of Sydney's main attractions. On our first day we walked from the Hotel to the Opera House via the Botanical Gardens, in all under a 30 minute walk. On the down side, the hotel is a rather odd shape, circular, and the room was quite small (think of a typical Hong Kong hotel room.) Also the hotel had a peculiar odor, which I can only describe as sour peas. Nonetheless, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was fine. For the money I was quite pleased with what we got. In the future I would probably stay at a property closer to Circular Quay, but given the circumstances I was pleasantly surprised with what we got and the price was more than fair.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel :)”
Reviews.Author: Karate80
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really nice, located right in the heart of Kings cross its great for a night out very easy to get to and right next door to Kings Cross train station. We stayed here after the Rihanna Concert. The rooms were really spacious and the pillows and bed were extra soft :) Staff were really nice and we asked them for a favour which they werent really allowed to do but went out of their way to please the customer which is always important. Would recommend anyone to stay here esp for a night out. Also considering where the location is you would think it would be really noisy but it wasnt!!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: emdoc
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from my Sydney trip and want to write my review while the experience is still fresh in my mind. After more than 20 hours of flights, I arrived in Sydney in the early morning jet-lagged and tired. After inquiring, I was directed to a bus outside that took us to the Central CityRail station free of charge. From there, I took the CityRail to the Kings Cross station. It turns out the Holiday Inn is less than a 30-seconds walk after getting out of the station. Really could not be closer or more convenient. It was 1030 in the morning and I was expecting to just drop off my luggage and returning later to check-in. Kimberly, working the front desk, immediately checked and told me that my room was ready for me. What a surprise and without prompting on my part. Also without any prompting from me, she asked if I would like a late check-out as late as 2 PM. Wow! Then I was asked for my newspaper preference in the morning. Maybe from a 5-star property but I didn't expect this from a Holiday Inn. So I checked in to my room at 1030 AM. Even though my room was only on the 2nd floor, I had a nice view of the Harbor Bridge and the Opera House. I imagine the view from the upper floors would be even better. Definitely get a room with the harbor view rather than the street view. Later that night I heard noises and looked out the window to see a fireworks show near the Harbor Bridge. Another nice bonus surprise. The room itself was spacious and clean with modern furnishings. If I want to nit-pick, the carpet had some stains. O/W I was pleased with everything else. I went downstairs to look for the business center and could not find it. Went looking down the wrong hallway and asked a cleaning lady who then walked me all the way to the computer terminals, she didn't just give me directions or point to its location. How's that for service. It costs A$5 for 15 minutes (or 30 minutes, I can't remember now). There was a small gym in the hotel but ask for the free pass to FitnessFirst that is located kind of kitty corner from the hotel. It's part of a chain of fitness clubs in Australia and has a nice variety of equipment. It's less than a minute walk from the hotel if not for the slow signal at the intersection. There was a restaurant in the hotel which I did not try but it looked nice. There were plenty of eating places nearby and with the CityRail station essentially right underneath the hotel, you could get all over the city easily. The hotel is close to the club area of Darlinghurst but I felt very safe. It's a bit more crowded and rowdy at night. Families with young children would likely avoid that area anyways. The immediate area surrounding the hotel and the short walk from the hotel to the CityRail station is perfectly safe for families. Every one of my multiple interactions with hotel staff resulted in prompt, friendly, courteous service. Overall a great experience and would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “a great budget offering”
Reviews.Author: leggygal
Reviews.Content: Got a particularly great deal from the IHC website while looking for a last minute place to stay as everyone I knew in town was full up. If you seek a clean, comfortable, affordable place to stay right in the action of the Kings Cross area but suprisingly quiet - then this is certainly a great option. Room service was tasty and affordable and my dealings with the reception desk were all pleasant. The gym is pretty tiny but fairly standard for these kinds of establishments - however the front desk can give you a pass to the gym across the road if you prefer - that really scored top marks in my book.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: AUTiger96
Reviews.Content: We were quite pleased with the location - easy access to trains downtown and walking distance to restaurants, shops, pubs, and cafes. Knowing very little about Sydney when we booked the trip, we were drawn to the good reviews and views. Since we were staying for over a week, we were upgraded to a room with a view and what a view it is! We frequently grabbed a quick breakfast with coffee at Joe's on Victoria. Great coffee less than a block away! The restaurants in Potts Point are close enough to walk to and the food is excellent - try Opium Den for some really great Thai! We walked to Newtown and the Mall on more than one occasion. It's a lovely walk through Hyde Park. We will likely stay here every time we go to Sydney. It's such a great location and we didn't find the Darlinghurst area to be sketchy at all. It's a nightclub area so it attracts a rowdy crowd on weekends but it didn't seem dangerous. The hotel is bright and clean with excellent amenities - a gym, laundry, and adjoining cocktail lounge and restaurant. A great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the noise!”
Reviews.Author: blakcloud
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is fantastic. Right on a train line, Kings Cross. It sits at the intersection of Victoria and Darlinghurst. These streets cross in a X fashion. The south part of Victoria has quaint restaurants that will satisfy any taste buds. As you cross over passed the hotel the street turns more into backpackers paradise with cheaper accommodations but is really nice. Darlinghust is another story. It has nightclubs, strip clubs and fast food. The doors to all these places are open and the music blasts out onto the street. It gets quite seedy in this area and one that I found unsafe. Young people flock to this area for nights of drinking. The noise was incredible which starts at 9 and ends about 4 in the morning. For some unknown reason, I never saw any police in this area, which it surely needed for crowd control. I was one of the unlucky hotel guests that has a room facing the street. I couldn't sleep because of the noise. It just went forever, regardless of the day and I stayed for five days. I asked the staff to move me to the back of the hotel, which they did and I then had the greatest time. The new room was practically silent and I had a view of the Opera House and Harbor Bridge. The view was a ten out of ten. The hotel is clean, the staff were one of the best in the hotel business but maybe because Australians are extremely nice and friendly. They truly make this hotel a great place to stay. The bed was great with lots of pillows. Heating and air conditioning worked great (we needed both during our stay.) I never went to the restaurant but it looked very nice. All in all the hotel looks renovated and is quite stylish. The room rates were unbelievably good which is a plus. If you are young and like crowds and clubs, this would be a great place to stay. If you are passed that stage in your life and want a quieter stay, make sure you ask for a room with a view and this will ensure you are far from the street and the noise. If it weren't for the noise, which is not the hotels fault, it would be getting a much higher rating.

Reviews.Title: “Ecellent Location and Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: UKSteveF
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days in October and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves - it looks like the hotel has been upgraded with a new bright entrance, comfortable rooms and helpful staff, We found many good breakfast places nearby (the hotel breakfast is reasonably priced but we wanted to experience Sydney as much as possible) and lots of good restaurants nearby for the evening. We would definitely stay here again..............

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great staff”
Reviews.Author: Mirror74
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the HI Potts Point for two days in king size bed room overlooking Sydney Opera House and Harbour Bridge. The hotel was great, very friendly and efficient staff, very clean, best breakfast in Australia for sure, great quality of food in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Queens Birthday Weekend”
Reviews.Author: shaneandhelen02
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days during the Queens Birthday weekend decided on this hotel because of the excellent reviews it had received and the location. I had requested a city view room when I booked but we arrived so early in the morning all they had available was a room on the first floor, clean and comfortable but with only a view of the neighbours tin rooves I went back to front desk and informed the attendant that we had booked the room a couple of weeks in advance and that my wife and I were having a bit of a get away so we'd really like something a few floors up with a nicer view. They were a little reluctant at first (Queens Birthday weekend so they knew the bookings would be coming in) but with a little pressing Sebastian the attendant came through for us with a room on the 5th floor. Again very clean and comfortable, even the matresses were comfy. Had breakfast and great coffee at La Bouvette a chiq little cafe just over 5 mins walk down Macleay Street from the hotel. The barista there is an Austrian bloke and he makes the best coffee. There's a Coles supermarket across the road from the hotel which was good for our bottled water. Hotel is close to the train station it's only 2 stops to Town Hall which takes you to the heart of the Sydney CBD and shopping district but if you're in a walking mood it's an easy stroll to the city and you can take in the sights of Woolloomoloo harbour and the Botanic Gardens along the way. If you get hungry while walking stop at Harry De Wheels cafe and have one of his famous pies topped with mash, peas and gravy or hot dogs with chilli con carne and hot sauce ... awesome. Lots of great cafes and restaurants nearby as well as pubs and clubs for the party goers. Don't forget to try Anderson's ice cream it's in the Cross. Also recommended Il Barretto Italian restaurant Surry Hills, check out Newtown a cool and funky place with a slightly alternative edge ... and if you see him say hi to my cousin Steve hehehe.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located and great views if you are in Sydney for a week”
Reviews.Author: ziggby
Reviews.Content: If you're going to be there for a week or so they'll probably give you a room with a view. If not I recommend you make sure to ask for one. Internet is ridiculously expensive and slow but the rest is cool, close to downtown and Potts Point. Don't be fooled by the name, it's actually in Kings Cross. I will be back though, it's a nice place and breakfast is good and the price is almost ok if you're spending Euros.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my stay here”
Reviews.Author: Zacharius
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just one night, but enjoyed it. Check in staff very nice, rooms basic but comfortable, no views to speak of but oh well. Right next to the metro station at Kings Cross, but the neighborhood is nothing exciting. The restaurant at the hotel is good and has a nice wine list, there are also a couple bars across the street if you want a nice cold beer at a good, non-hotel price. I would stay here again for sure, but there are still other places (and areas) I would prefer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Kxi
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn has a great location. It is in the centre of Kings Cross. So if you like the nightlife then this is the place for you - so convenient and easy to get home to. If you're after relaxation then I would skip this place, despite being quiet. The rooms are quiet, large and the clean. A very pleasant stay. Staff are extremely pleasant and helpful. The hotel is secure and has many facilities. Breakfast buffet looks good, but being in the middle of Kings Cross you have so many options. There are plenty of small cafe's close all offering full breakfasts. So spoilt for choice. The prices range, so there is a good selection for all types.

Reviews.Title: “Great location Great value”
Reviews.Author: Michael647
Reviews.Content: Top spot, right price, nice place. I've stayed here a number of times over the years and always found it to be a well-run hotel. In about 2000 it was where the top bands for the Big Day Out stayed so it's a decent place. One thing I would watch out for - if you check in after midnight the staff seem to make you pay well above the advertised rate. One night I went to the desk and asked the price. Two hours later I came back with my bags and the price for a room had jumped $60.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and well located”
Reviews.Author: renbabe
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Potts point Hoilday Inn as part of our stays in Sydney. The 'room with a view' was excellent and we loved opening the black out blinds every morning and watching the sun coming up over a wonderful city. The room was a good size, bed comfy, bathroom spotless. Room service was also good. The breakfast within the hotel (which was extra) was really tasty and probably the best we had whilst on our travels. The area is within easy walking distance of the centre of town and also next to the train station so you can hop on a train to darling harbour and connect easily with the monorail if you fancy. The area - compared to Kings Cross - was a little adult but fun and we did not feel uncomforatble or unsafe. Overall this hotel offers an excellent stay and we would recommend it if you are looking for a middle of the range hotel for your stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: collarbone
Reviews.Content: Arrived here at 6 am after 36 hours travelling fully expecting to wait until 2pm to get a room. However, we were given a room immediately. Unfortunately, the room was on the top floor underneath what must have been the air conditioning system the noises coming from it were loud and persistent! We asked to change rooms and this was done with the minimum of fuss and were were upgraded to a room with a view of the harbour for the rest of our stay 17 nights! It appears to be one of the cheapest Holiday Inn hotels but doesn't lack in quality. For us as walkers the location was near enought to walk to anywhere in the city but if you are not it's right next to the station. Kings X can be quite sleazy but we never felt in any danger here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Goldellen
Reviews.Content: We travelled with friends and requested rooms with a view. Our rooms were good and had fantastic views of the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge. The area around the hotel is 'interesting' with a good choice of places to eat within walking distance. It's just around the corner from Kings Cross rail station and within walking distance of all major tourist attractions. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly and if I was lucky enough to visit Sydney again I would head straight back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, great location”
Reviews.Author: ActRegular_traveller
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before and this time were given a city-side room. At the price we paid it is luck of the draw but the city-side rooms are slightly larger than Victoria Rd side I think. And the view was pretty good (higher floors are better). Hotel seemed lightly booked, given it was a public holiday long weekend, probably due to the wild weather, which may be why we got city-side rooms for the lower price. A lot quieter this time - previously we got a room near the lifts & it was noisier. As others mention, location is a big plus for this hotel. Right above Kings Cross Railway Station and within easy walk of lots of restaurants. We didn't walk far this time due to weather but used trains. Of course, not far (50 metres) from the start of the"entertainment" strip of Kings Cross, which is either a plus or a minus depending on your perspective - easy to avoid if you aren't interested. We left our car in their garage until 1pm after checking out (no additional parking fee - just the fee for the time we had been booked in), went back into city for some additional shopping time. Check in and check out was uneventful, staff helpful and friendly. The value for money of this hotel, proximity to CBD, access to trains and ease of getting there from main expressways make it a regular winner for us.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, location, but not kid friendly area”
Reviews.Author: TokyoBob1975
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel for everybody except those with small children. The area immediately around the hotel is not child friendly--homeless, pan handlers, adult oriented businesses, etc. No big deal, but it should be taken into consideration. Very mild by red light district standards, but it might make some uncomfortable. Spent 4 nights with a city view which is great. Study CityRail website (Sydney's light rail system). I used it to and from the International Airport--great, but realize it is very crowded during rush hour. I was OK with my bags, but can I can imagine some might be challenged manuvering their bags during rush hour. In room HiSpeed Internet access via LAN cable was AU$29.95/day. Being expected to pay is not unheard of, but that is about 3 times the going hotel rate. I did not pay. Room was great. Suprised there was no international news broadcast channel (CNN, BBC, etc) offered. I like to walk, so I was able to walk to Sydney Opera and all major tourist areas within 25 minutes. If not, CityRail is accessible via Kings Cross station which will take you to any major location but will require at least one transfer.

Reviews.Title: “harbour views were good”
Reviews.Author: travellerDevon
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok and staff were efficient. It is a typical chain hotel - little character. the rooms have all you would expect to have for the price. I was shocked when asked to pay for internet access. even the backpackers places were offering free internet access. The hotel was asking for 5-10 aus dollars - thought that was over the top. also hotel location is right over Kings Cross station. However Victoria Street is fine and can recommend Roy's for eating in!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for me”
Reviews.Author: Stanleytic
Reviews.Content: I stayed 15 nights at this hotel for a business trip. I recommend that you do everything you can to get a harbour view room as, like a previous reviewer has written, the view is stunning and is a great way to wind down after a days work by drinking a cold beer looking at the view and watching the sun go down. Alternatively, sit in the bar and watch the Virgin Blue cabin crew checking in for a different kind of view! Facilities wise the hotel meets all the requirements and I found the staff very helpful for any question. It's ideally suited to get to the CBD and the shopping areas (20 minute walk or 5 min train journey to Martins Place an Town Hall (Kings Cross station is right next door). I will definitely stay here again should I return to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Badgerer1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the Ashes tour, Great hotel, had a fantastic time. Well situated, friendly staff and great food!! Would reccomend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning view”
Reviews.Author: AnnieCL
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights (2-4 Dec) in one of the Grand View Queen rooms. You cannot put a price on the view of the Opera House/Bridge whilst sipping a drink in bed!!! The location of the hotel is about a 20 min walk into the parks and main attractions of Sydney. There are some good eateries along Darlinghurst Road. The train station is in front of the hotel. The room was well presented and kept very clean. The buffet breakfast was ample and a good start to the day. The staff on breakfast duty were amongst the friendliest we had come across during our stay and paid our young daughter alot of attention. This was our second time staying here, our first being several years ago whilst on the backpacker trail, we just needed to spoil ourselves with clean sheets back then! We did notice a difference between this hotel and the Old Sydney, particularly the staff overall, the 'Can Do' attitude and overall atmosphere was missing here. The hotel cannot be faulted but the Old Sydney is the one for us.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at Holiday Inn Potts Point”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn in May this year with my husband and son, at the start and end of our holiday. We had an enjoyable stay. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful and our room was spacious, even if it did not have such a good view. We were given a room at the back of the hotel away from the busy road. We ate out locally the first few days and then tried out the restaurant in the hotel for the last few nights. We were pleasantly surprised as the food both for breakfast and evening meal was very good and reasonably priced compared to some places we have stayed. Children eat free for both breakfast and evening meal, there is a childrens menu in the evening which you can choose from. They are also given coloured pencils so that they can draw on the paper tablecloths that are on each table, meaning that they do not get bored inbetween courses - a brilliant idea! Our son had great fun drawing all the things that he had seen that day. I would just mention that the hotel is not in Potts Point. It is in Kings Cross, right next to the station. Luckily we did not have any noise from the station, and it was very convenient for getting into the sights. It was also not far to walk with sore feet after pounding the pavements all day! Would recommend that you take a taxi from the airport - approx $35 for us, as the train cost about the same and involved a change of line, hassle you can do without when you are dragging suitcases around! If you wish to use the internet would advise you go to the backpackers travel agent across the road to the left of the hotel. Cost $1 for 20 mins, whereas the hotel was $5 for 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service - beautiful views”
Reviews.Author: threesixtydegrees360
Reviews.Content: Walking out from the adjacent underground train station into the leafy Potts Point was a delight. There were plenty of restaurants and great shopping just a short walk away. The hotel itself is a very clean, smart hotel. The staff were very friendly and really wanted to help. (A very rare trait for some hotels) However the great feature of this hotel were the views of the Opera House and Harbour from my room. In the daylight they were spectacular but as the lights came on into the city night the views were just beyond amazing. I have lived in Sydney for a little while now and have never seen it like that before. I truely recommend this hotel for its service, facilities and most of all its views!

Reviews.Title: “inconsistent and rude”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: some staff tried, others were plain rude i was a cash paying guest. previously never a problem. this time....no movies, no phone, no room service unless i went down to reception and paid each time. upon complaining, i was recieving help from a helpful night manager before being confronted by the another manager who was rude and abrupt, and when i told him i was "pissed off" called security saying that i was using offensive language. not good enough

Reviews.Title: “will be back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My second home. Service is perfect,breakfast is great and dinner too.I love the area and the staff is very very helpful.Give it a go!!!!!

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Potts Point - Sydney
HotelInfo.Address: 203 Victoria St | Potts Point, Sydney, New South Wales 2011, Australia
